org.cambillaum.concurrencyutils.lock

Interface MultiLock<E>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ReentrantMultiLock

    public interface MultiLock<E>
    An interface providing central locking capabilities that can be shared across a whole application. This interface is especially useful when you need to synchronize objects and cannot modify their code. By instantiating one of this interface's implementation and making it accessible through the ServletContext or Spring's ApplicationContext or even through an Application EJB, any component can acquire and release locks attached to specific instances of a class. Here is a usage example: 
     MultiLock multiLock = new ReentrantMultiLock();
 multiLock.lock(1);
 multiLock.lock(2);
 multiLock.lock(3);
 //Here do operations on instances of some entity object
 //that have 1,2 and 3
 //as id and may be concurrent to other operations on these instances
 multiLock.unLock(3);
 multiLock.unLock(2);
 multiLock.unLock(1);
    Author:
    Mathieu Cambillau

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void lock(E e)
      Try to acquire lock on e.
      void unLock(E e)
      Releases the lock on e.

    • Method Detail

      • lock

        void lock(E e)
        Try to acquire lock on e. This call blocks until the lock can be acquired.
        Parameters:
        e - the instance on which the locks is to be acquired.

      • unLock

        void unLock(E e)
        Releases the lock on e.
        Parameters:
        e - the instance on which the lock is to be released.
